required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Evidence Based Delivery Model of Care for Newly Implanted Adult CI Recipients
clinical_study.official_title: An Evidence Based Delivery Model of Care for Newly Implanted Adult CI Recipients

brief_summary.textblock: The clinical investigation is evaluating a new clinical model in a group of newly implanted subjects who have already been consented to CI surgery.

clinical_study.why_stopped: FDA determination of Fox software as class III medical device, not CDSS.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in time spent with audiologist
primary_outcome.description: Change in the overall number of minutes of cochlear implant appointments over the first 6 months post activation in the new model (Group A) compared to the traditional model (Group B).

arm_group.description: Traditional clinical model which is not standardized across clinical sites

intervention.description: Patients will have self directed equipment education and standardized programming approaches

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are receiving a NucleusÂ® CI512, CI522, or CI532 electrodes
- 18 years and older
- Postlingual onset of hearing loss (onset of hearing loss >two years of age)
- Individuals who qualify for cochlear implantation using the clinics current CI candidacy criteria
- Individuals who have recently been implanted but not yet had their external device activated
- Willingness to participate in a study and comply with all study requirements
- Fluent in spoken English
Exclusion Criteria:
- Ossification or any other cochlear anomaly that might prevent insertion of less than 10 electrodes of the electrode array
- Diagnosis of retro-cochlear pathology
- Diagnosis of auditory neuropathy
- Subject considering an acoustic component in the implanted ear
- Unrealistic expectations on the part of the subject regarding the possible benefits, risks, and limitations that are inherent to the surgical procedure and use of the prosthetic device
- Unwillingness or inability to comply with all investigational requirements
- Severe-profound sensorineural hearing loss >30 years
- Previous cochlear implant in the contralateral ear. Additional cognitive, medical or social handicaps that would prevent completion of all study requirements as determined by the investigator
